descbody.para: All information contained in these manuals is intended exclusively for automotive industry professionals.
Since this documentation is intended to cover all vehicles in the RENAULT range, throughout the world, it does not include equipment designed for use in specific countries.
The procedures and fault finding procedures recommended and described in this manual have been designed by automotive industry repair professionals.

description.title: Special notes on electric and hybrid vehicles

noteR.para: Any work performed on the vehicle's high-voltage network poses a risk of death by electrocution. The operator is trained and authorised by their employer, subject to certain mandatory skills and training requirements.

To ensure that the electric motor and transmission assembly, the fan assembly, heating or air conditioning do not start up automatically during storage and/or before operations on the vehicle, ensure that the automatic advance heating/cooling features (air conditioning activation button on RENAULT Card, air conditioning programmable activation, air conditioning remote activation) have been switched off.

descbody.para: If the vehicle is fitted with a Renault hands-free card, never press the button to activate the air conditioning on the Renault hands-free card during an operation.
Disable the programming of the air conditioning on the instrument panel.
Disable the programming of the remotely controlled air conditioning by locking out the 12 V supply circuit 12 V supply circuit: lockout - removal of lockoutGIEMR-000508.
After repair, return the vehicle to the customer's original configuration.

Operations on certain equipment and certain parts (for instance: spring-shock absorber assembly, electric traction reduction gearing, brake system, ABS, airbag, etc.) require particular attention to be paid to safety, cleanliness and care.
The safety symbol used in this manual indicates that special attention must be paid to the procedure or the tightening torque values.
Protect your health by following the Safety Principles:

entry.para: Safety principles
Key points
5S
Always keep the work station clean and tidy. To reduce the risk of falling, do not leave any parts on the floor.
Lockout (LOTO)
If you notice any defects in the equipment or tooling, inform your manager, who will quarantine the faulty items.
Tooling
Never wear jewellery at any work station.
Always use tooling that is in good condition and suited to the task to be performed. Follow the recommendations for use.
Use hand tools with the appropriate force. Always bear in mind that the tool could slip and cause injury to anyone nearby (sharp implement).
Apply force in such a way that you keep out of danger or, if this is not possible, protect the sharp implement.
Always stay away from moving parts that could start up as you are working (belt, fan, etc.). Refer to the repair procedure to check if the battery should be disconnected.
Driving
When doing a road test, always fit trade plates, stick to the set test route and observe the highway code.
Lifting
Always apply the repair procedure vehicle: towing and liftingGIEMR-002447 specific to the vehicle.
Never get into a vehicle when it raised.
Use at least 2 support points, whatever the operation (a single axle stand or single jack is not acceptable).
Chemical products
Only use products recommended by Renault in their original packaging. Use in accordance with the hazard pictograms on the packaging.
Always allow a cooling system to cool down before opening the cap on the expansion bottle: risk of severe burns.
Always use fume extractors, positioned as close as possible to the source (exhaust, etc.).
Personal Protective Equipment
Always wear the recommended personal protective equipment:

ul.li: safety footwear, at all times,
gloves suited to the task (cut-resistant, resistant to chemicals, etc.),
safety spectacles when working under the body or in the engine compartment, and when performing any task that presents a projection hazard (blowing, hammering, etc.),
cap with visor when working under the body,
hearing protection for operations > 85 dB (blowing, impact spanner, etc.),
PPE specific to bodywork-paintwork (active carbon mask, painter's overalls, etc.).

entry.para: Ergonomy

To raise a vehicle, use the lifting equipment (lift table, lift, etc.) and handling equipment (workshop hoist, wheel dolly, etc.) provided to maintain a correct posture and avoid putting the body under strain.
Support
Never handle fuel (draining, disconnecting unions, etc.) close to hot spots (exhaust, turbo, etc.).
Use of a telephone at a work station or during road tests is forbidden.
Certain operations (high voltage electricity, LPG, etc.) require accreditation: never undertake such operations without the correct accreditation.

descbody.para: Repair work may result in risks of environmental pollution if certain precautions are not taken.
Above all, avoid wastage, reduce consumption and produce less waste.
Protect the environment by observing the Basics for the Environment:

entry.para: Basics for the environment
Key points
Ground
Report any incident, leak or spillage involving liquid chemical products.
Use the appropriate equipment in the event of spillage or leaks (absorbents, shovels, inflatable stoppers or drain mats, oil recovery trays).
Air-Energy
Do not allow waste refrigerants to escape into the atmosphere.
Switch off electronic equipment at the end of the day.
Waste
Sort waste into: hazardous, recyclable or other.
Store liquid waste in a sealed container on an appropriate support.
Do not burn waste, products or scrap parts (tyres, etc.).
Water
Do not pour any fluids used in vehicles (oil, brake fluid, coolant, etc.) down a drain and do not put them in a waste bin.

descbody.para: Observe basic principles of vehicle repair.
The quality of repair depends first and foremost on the care exercised by the person in carrying it out.
To ensure good repair:

ul.li: protect the sensitive areas of the vehicle (seats, steering wheel, wings, etc.),
unless otherwise indicated, all repairs must be done with the ignition off,
when welding on the vehicle, it is advisable to remove or disconnect components near the repair area that could be affected by the heat,
use recommended professional products and original parts,
observe the tightening torques,
replace roll pins, self-locking or bonded nuts or bolts every time they are removed,
take care with electrical and electronic components which cannot withstand excess voltage and improper handling; replace any electrical and electronic components that have been dropped,
make sure that the connectors are correctly clipped,
do not pull on the wiring,
check for the sealing plugs on the connectors,
do not just replace parts one after the other, carry out detailed fault finding beforehand,
carry out a final check before returning the vehicle to the customer (set the clock, check the alarm operation, check the lights and indicators, etc.),
clean and degrease the sections to be bonded (threads, stub axle splines) to ensure proper adherence.

Protect the accessories and timing belts, the electrical accessories (starter, blanking cover, electric power-assisted steering pump) and the mating face to prevent fluid spilling onto the clutch friction plate.

descbody.para: Before carrying out any work under the bonnet, use the button in the passenger compartment to deactivate the Stop & Start system (if fitted).

If the vehicle is equipped with the engine remote starting system, never press the button on the key (or smartphone) which starts the engine while carrying out operations or while the vehicle is parked in a servicing area.
Disable programming of multimedia components when entering a servicing area.

The design quality of our vehicles demands that nothing is left to chance in making a good repair, and it is essential to refit parts or components exactly as they were originally (for instance: heat shields, wiring routing, pipe routing, particularly in the area of the orange high-voltage wiring).
Do not blow away dust (brakes, etc.), vacuum them up or clean the component with a cleaning agent (such as a brake cleaning product).
Use professional products and apply them with care, for example do not apply too much sealing paste to the sealing surface.
Exhaust gases (petrol and diesel) are pollutants. Operate engines or stand-alone heaters with care and always use exhaust gas extractors.

Ensure that there is no risk of a short circuit occurring when the electrical connections are reconnected (e.g. charger, converter, traction battery and 12 V battery, etc.). Some points need greasing, others do not, therefore particular attention should be paid during refitting operations to ensure that they work properly under all conditions.

description.title: Special notes on electric and hybrid vehicles

descbody.para: Any operation on the high voltage network of a hybrid or electric vehicle requires the vehicle to be secured: apply the vehicle lockout procedure vehicle: lockout - removal of lockoutGIEMR-002439.

noteR.para: Risks of serious burns or electric shocks that may prove fatal.
It is strictly forbidden to repair Orange High-Voltage connectors and wiring.

descbody.para: Take care not to damage orange high-voltage cables.
Systematicly replace damaged high-voltage cables.

noteR.para: To prevent contamination of disconnected connectors and sockets, hermetically seal the connectors and sockets using a plastic bag and a securing clip. For traction battery sockets, use traction battery capsvehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.

descbody.para: For any prolonged disconnection of connectors of the orange high-voltage circuit, verify the presence of plugs or protection plastic bags.

Do not splash any type of liquid (oil, cleaner, etc.) on the electric and electronic components (charger, converter, electric engine, wiring and connectors, traction battery and 12 V battery, computers, sensors, etc.)
It is forbidden:

ul.li: to connect an adapter or extension lead to the charging lead of a hybrid or electric vehicle,
to clean the vehicle while it is charging,
to clean the powertrain, the interior of the vehicle's air inlets as well as all high-voltage components underneath the car's body (including the traction battery),
to clean any part of the charging cable during charging,
to perform servicing or maintenance on the hybrid or electric vehicle while it is charging.

descbody.para: The repair procedures have been designed using special tools; they must therefore be carried out using these tools to ensure a high degree of working safety and quality of repair.
The equipment we have approved has undergone careful research and testing, and must be used and maintained with care.

New repair procedures are constantly being developed in the interests of repair quality, either with new products (emission control, injection, electronics, etc.), or in fault finding. Be sure to consult the Workshop Repair Manuals or Technical Notes or fault finding summaries before any servicing operation.
Since vehicle specifications are subject to change during their commercial life, it is essential to check whether there are any updated Technical Notes when seeking information.

The procedures contained in this document merit your attention. Please read them carefully in order to reduce the risk of injury, and avoid using incorrect procedures that could damage the vehicle or make it dangerous in use.
Following the recommended procedures will help you to provide a quality of service which will ensure the vehicles achieve the highest levels of performance and reliability.
Maintenance and repair operations must be carried out under the proper conditions to ensure that our vehicles run safely and reliably.
